author: julianfoad
msg: Move a parameter into a baton, for tidiness. A follow-up to r33602.
* subversion/libsvn_client/merge.c
(merge_cmd_baton_t): Add a field 'use_sleep'.
(drive_merge_report_editor, do_file_merge, do_directory_merge): Use the
'use_sleep' field in the baton instead of taking it as a separate
parameter.
(do_merge): Initialise the 'use_sleep' field in the baton.

author: julianfoad
msg: Fix the test suite's parsing of "svn status" output. It went wrong when the
working revision field was "?", e.g. on an item whose status is "missing".
No tests seem to have been adversely affected by this.
* subversion/tests/cmdline/svntest/tree.py
(build_tree_from_status): Skip white space before the working revision
field with the regex " +" rather than accidentally eating other
characters with the regex "   [^0-9-]*".

author: julianfoad
msg: In the test suite, avoid explicit reference to the test base directory from
within tests. This is a code improvement, not a functional change.
* subversion/tests/cmdline/diff_tests.py
(make_diff_header): New function.
(diff_base_to_repos, diff_schedule_delete, diff_mime_type_changes,
diff_repos_wc_add_with_props, diff_repos_working_added_dir,
diff_weird_author, diff_ignore_whitespace, diff_ignore_eolstyle,
diff_in_renamed_folder, diff_backward_repos_wc_copy): Use
make_diff_header() instead of writing out the header long-hand. Pass an
existing path variable instead of writing out the path long-hand.
(diff_external_diffcmd): Run the test within its WC directory so as to
avoid references to the WC directory in the expected output.
* subversion/tests/cmdline/import_tests.py
(import_eol_style): Run the test within its WC directory so as to
avoid references to the WC directory in the expected output.
* subversion/tests/cmdline/special_tests.py
(diff_symlink_to_dir): Run the test within its WC directory so as to
avoid references to the WC directory in the expected output.

author: julianfoad
msg: Tweak some documentation in the test suite.
* subversion/tests/cmdline/svntest/actions.py
(run_and_verify_update): Document that OUTPUT_TREE and DISK_TREE are
optional.

author: rhuijben
msg: Stop sleeping after each individual merge when batching several merges in
a single command (Cherry picking)
Implement this by passing a svn_boolean_t* use_sleep to all function that
require a sleep for timestamp integrity. The calling function will then call
svn_sleep_for_timestamps() when use_sleep is set to TRUE.
* subversion/libsvn_client/merge.c
(drive_merge_report_editor, do_file_merge): Add use_sleep parameter and set
its value to TRUE instead of calling svn_sleep_for_timestamps().
(do_directory_merge, do_merge, merge_cousins_and_supplement_mergeinfo):
Add use_sleep parameter and pass it to functions now requiring this
parameter.
(svn_client_merge3, svn_client_merge_reintegrate, svn_client_merge_peg3):
Pass use_sleep parameters to functions and call svn_sleep_for_timestamps() if
this value is TRUE. Also check for use_sleep if the function returns
an error.
Found by: Sander Rijken <sander@open.collab.net>
(and the 'very sleepy' profiler)
